With the ability to lift massive payloads into orbit, this technology would greatly reduce the cost and complexity of space exploration, enabling the deployment of solar panels, satellites, and even space-based solar power stations.

**Subsonic Skimmers**: Picture a futuristic, wing-in-ground-effect (WIG) aircraft that can travel at speeds of up to 1,000 km/h (621 mph) while staying just above the surface of the water. With the ability to travel long distances over water, these aircraft would revolutionize maritime transportation, reducing travel times and increasing the efficiency of global trade.
